comments:
Using eclipse-SDK-I20051130-1215-win32 
received below class cast exception. 

I had recently started a fresh workspace, and was importing team project set 
from a 3.1.1 workspace (and hit cancel when asked for a repository password 
I didn't understand). 

And, I was doing several things at once, so not sure if releated, but I had
also recently imported (all) preferences from a 3.1.1 based dev. env. 

If it matters, I'm "running" on a JDK 1.5 Java runtime. 
J2RE 1.5.0 IBM Windows 32 build pwi32dev-20051104

I kept getting the class cast exception (in console log) .. just diplayed error dialog once) ... and not problems/warnings displayed. 

I closed and re-opened problems veiw and all seemed fine after that. 

BTW, ... I really like what you're doing with the problems view and its filters! 

- - - - 
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2005-12-04 15:06:35.372
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Fetching children of Problems".
!STACK 0
java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.ui.views.markers.internal.TableSorter 
incompatible with org.eclipse.ui.views.markers.internal.CategorySorter
        at org.eclipse.ui.views.markers.internal.MarkerAdapter.getCategorySorter
(MarkerAdapter.java:175)
        at org.eclipse.ui.views.markers.internal.MarkerAdapter.buildHierarchy(Ma
rkerAdapter.java:319)
        at org.eclipse.ui.views.markers.internal.MarkerAdapter.buildAllMarkers(M
arkerAdapter.java:272)
        at org.eclipse.ui.views.markers.internal.MarkerAdapter.fetchDeferredChil
dren(MarkerAdapter.java:195)
        at org.eclipse.ui.progress.DeferredTreeContentManager$1.run(DeferredTree
ContentManager.java:192)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
I think this one is fixed is the latest builds but I will double check
David I assume you were in hierarchal mode?

well, not sure, since wasn't working. I was using what ever's default (though, don't know if me importing preferences from a 3.1 workspace would effect that). 
And, once I closed and reopened, it was hierarchical.

I tried to recreate this problem with I20051206-1200 and could not. 
So your comment #1 is correct. Feel free to close, unless there's more 
you want to do. ... Just trying to help. :)
